page.title: 01Gazettteer-Grid Ref.0384031
page.content: This is a flat mainly rural area with a scattering of brick farmhouses and cottages mainly of the nineteeth century.The land is intensivly farmed,farms being mainly mixed,with dairy and beef cattle,fields of wheat, barley,oats and pulses.Many of the crops grown are used as cattle fodder. In the west is a large fruit farm which exports some of its produce. The area includes two villages,Bradley and Haughton and the small hamlet of Apeton Bradley is a small compact village with a population of about 400. The centre of the village is a conservation area. Haughton is a village that has grown up along the main Newport to Stafford road.The modern housing is concentrated around the church and on one side of the road.Each of the villages has a church and a First school.The children transfer at age 9 to middle school.
